description: Decimal expansion of sine of 20 degrees.
links: Ivan Panchenko, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
prog: (PARI) /* for x = 20 degrees, sin(9x) = 0 *//* so sin(x) is a zero of this polynomial */sin_9(x)=9*x-120*x^3+432*x^5-576*x^7+256*x^9x=34;y=100;print(3);print(4);for(digits=1, 110, {d=0;y=y*10;while(sin_9((10*x+d)/y) > 0, d++);d--; /* while loop overshoots correct digit */print(d); x=10*x+d})\\ _Michael B. Porter_, Jan 27 2010
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
